name: CompuDreams Unlimited (Tampa Store), The Offshore Firm (2021)
description:
“CompuDreams Unlimited (Tampa Store)”
 The Offshore Firm (2021)

////// At first glance, you wonder why The Offshore Firm would need to maintain a computer store brand with franchises across the Continental U.S. After all, if the Offshore Firm has offices on the moon and mars, surely they don't need brick and mortar shops to guide and manage the wealth of the world's elite? But as they say, "Mysterious is the portfolio that gives." The store has an odd smell, but the atmosphere is peaceful. The retail workers look like twins and you notice that they are somewhat translucent in the afternoon light. //////

Metarealistic game photography depicting hypercorporate, antisocial, and sometimes liminal virtual environments.

This photographed scene was created using "The Life Stage: Virtual House," a building design simulator released in 1993 for the 3DO console.

Although the game has fallen into obscurity, it was notably ahead of its time for its use of photographic gameplay elements within an immersive 3D virtual space.

// Artwork by Sabato Visconti // www.sabatobox.com // @sabatobox on IG //
